text: The 2002 Australian Formula Ford Championship was a CAMS sanctioned Australian motor racing title open to Formula Ford racing cars.Specific Conditions, 2002 CAMS Manual of Motor Sport, page 7-13 It was the tenth Australian Formula Ford Championship.Australian Titles, 2006 CAMS Manual of Motor Sport, page 14-5 The title was won by Jamie Whincup driving a Van Diemen RF 01 Ford.Final Pointscore, 2002 Ford Racing Australian Formula Ford Championship, www.formulaford.com.au via web.archive.org Retrieved on 24 July 2013 ==Calendar== The Spectrum 09 in which Mark Winterbottom placed 2nd in the championship The championship was contested over an eight round series with two races per round. {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA-Macro for EXCEL tableconversion 14 September | Marcus Marshall | Van Diemen RF01 Ford |} ==Points system== Championship points were awarded on a 20-16-14-12-10-8-6-4-2-1 basis to the top ten placegetters in each race. An additional point was awarded to the driver setting pole position at each round. ==Results== {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA-Macro for EXCEL tableconversion V1.4<\hiddentext> |- style="font-weight:bold" !
